main event: An unusual object was observed at an altitude of approximately 800 feet, identified using ground radar by airmen, in Bethel, Alaska on March 8, 1962.
interesting points: The object was described as a bright orange-red light pulsating irregularly., It moved in erratic flight patterns and disappeared from radar after about 15 minutes., No visual sightings were made, complicating the identification of the object., The object remained unidentified due to its unusual flight characteristics and disappearance., Weather conditions during the observation were clear and cold with high winds.
